com.redhat.rhn.common.util
Class Asserts

java.lang.Object
  com.redhat.rhn.common.util.Asserts

public final class Asserts
extends java.lang.Object

Assertions that should be used to check parameters on public methods. Note that, as opposed to the assert keyword, these checks can not and should not be turned off.

See Sun's assert specification for recommended best practices.

Method Summary

          Assert that coll contains elem

assertNotEmpty

public static void assertNotEmpty(java.lang.String s)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Verify that a string is not empty and throw a runtime exception if so. A parameter is considered empty if it is null, or if it does not contain any characters that are non-whitespace.

Parameters:
s - the string to check for emptiness
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if s is an empty string

assertEquals

public static void assertEquals(java.lang.Object expected,
                                java.lang.Object actual)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Verify that two values are equal (according to their equals method, unless expected is null, then according to ==).

Parameters:
expected - Expected value.
actual - Actual value.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if expected is not equal to actual

fail

public static void fail(java.lang.String msg)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This is the equivalent of assertTrue(false, msg).

Parameters:
msg - A string describing the condition of failure.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - always
